chapter_location: Chapter 1: A Long-expected Party
description: Frodo inherits the One Ring from Bilbo during his birthday celebration.

chapter_location: Book 4, Chapter 1: The Taming of Sméagol
description: Frodo continues his journey with Sam and captures Gollum as they traverse the rocky Emyn Muil.

chapter_location: Book 6, Chapter 1: The Tower of Cirith Ungol
description: Frodo is imprisoned in the tower, and Sam plans to rescue him in the land of Mordor.

chapter_location: Chapter 3: Three is Company
description: Sam leaves the Shire with Frodo and begins their journey through the woods towards Bree.

chapter_location: Book 6, Chapter 1: The Tower of Cirith Ungol
description: Sam courageously infiltrates the orc tower in Mordor to rescue Frodo.

chapter_location: Chapter 10: Strider
description: Aragorn is introduced in the Prancing Pony inn as a ranger who joins the Fellowship.

chapter_location: Book 3, Chapter 1: The Departure of Boromir
geographical_location: Amon Hen, near the Anduin River
description: Aragorn finds Boromir fatally wounded and resolves to track the orcs who captured Merry and Pippin.

chapter_location: Book 5, Chapter 2: The Passing of the Grey Company
description: Aragorn leads the Grey Company through the haunted Paths of the Dead to summon the army of the dead.

chapter_location: Chapter 2: The Shadow of the Past
description: Gandalf explains the history of the One Ring to Frodo in Bag End, warning of the danger it holds.

chapter_location: Book 3, Chapter 5: The White Rider
description: Gandalf returns as Gandalf the White and meets Aragorn, Legolas, and Gimli in Fangorn Forest.

chapter_location: Book 2, Chapter 3: The Ring Goes South
description: Legolas joins the Fellowship at Rivendell, representing the elves in the quest to destroy the One Ring.

chapter_location: Book 2, Chapter 3: The Ring Goes South
description: Gimli, son of Glóin, represents the dwarves and joins the Fellowship in Rivendell.

chapter_location: Book 2, Chapter 2: The Council of Elrond
description: Boromir arrives at Rivendell seeking counsel and becomes a member of the Fellowship to defend Gondor.

chapter_location: Book 4, Chapter 1: The Taming of Sméagol
description: Gollum is captured by Frodo and Sam in the rocky hills of Emyn Muil, and becomes their guide.

chapter_location: Book 3, Chapter 10: The Voice of Saruman
description: Saruman, defeated and imprisoned in Orthanc, tries to use his persuasive voice to deceive the victors.

chapter_location: Book 2, Chapter 7: The Mirror of Galadriel
description: Galadriel reveals her wisdom and power to the Fellowship, offering Frodo a glimpse into possible futures.

chapter_location: Book 2, Chapter 2: The Council of Elrond
description: Elrond convenes a council to discuss the fate of the One Ring, leading to the formation of the Fellowship.

chapter_location: Book 3, Chapter 6: The King of the Golden Hall
description: Éowyn is introduced as the niece of King Théoden and shows her desire to fight for Rohan.

chapter_location: Book 3, Chapter 2: The Riders of Rohan
description: Éomer leads a band of Rohirrim and encounters Aragorn, Legolas, and Gimli in the plains of Rohan.

chapter_location: Book 3, Chapter 6: The King of the Golden Hall
description: Théoden, under Saruman's spell, is freed by Gandalf and rallies the forces of Rohan.

chapter_location: Book 4, Chapter 5: The Window on the West
description: Faramir, captain of Gondor, encounters Frodo and Sam and learns of the Ring in the woods of Ithilien.

chapter_location: Book 3, Chapter 4: Treebeard
description: Treebeard, the eldest of the Ents, befriends Merry and Pippin and leads the Ents to war against Isengard.
